name: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2485
Reason: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point that can be predicted by considering the functional groups present in the molecule. The basic unit for comparison is 1-methyl-3-phenyl-1H-pyrazole, which has a melting point of approximately 100 degrees Celsius. The methyl group (–CH3) adds approximately +5 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The 2,4,6-trimethylphenyl group (C1=C(C=C1)C) adds approximately +30 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and aromaticity. The pyrazole ring itself contributes approximately +10 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and rigidity.
